Posts.Content: Feb 25, 2008 04:50PM Marj4230 wrote: I have had my drain in 17 days and still getting 90cc of fluid daily.  Hopefully, it comes out in 2 days.  It hadn't drained on it's own for 13 days, we had to strip it to get anything out, then yesterday it started draining on it's own after I passed a big blood clot.  Very strange!
Posts.Title: Drain Removal CBJ otter

Posts.Content: Feb 20, 2008 06:54PM Marj4230 wrote: Has anyone had problems with their drain not draining.  The only way mine drains is if we strip it manually, then it drains for a minute, then stops until we strip it again.  I'm 12 days post op.  I saw the p/s today, but we're still getting quite a bit of fluid.  If we don't strip the line, my armpit swells up and becomes very uncomfortable.   I'm tempted to put some alcohol in the bulb and see if this frees the valve between the tube and the bulb.  Any ideas??
